page.title: 07Roads,High Lorton/Whinlatter
page.content: There are not many{roads}at all in this block.The 'main' one is {Whinlatter Pass,}part of the B5292, which links Lorton and Braithwaite near Keswick.It mainly goes through fells and forest.There are two disused stone quarries alongside it,but hardly any houses.Sometimes,in winter,it is closed because of{snow and ice. The only other roads in the block are in the village of High Lorton,plus the 'old road' which goes from the village onto the pass.They are all quite{narrow}and{twisty}and apart from one short stretch in the village have {no footpaths.}Most are bordered by { {dry-stone walls}or{hedges.}Drivers must look out for{sheep}which often stray onto the road. There is{little traffic},although in summer coach-tours and holiday-makers drive through.There is{no bus-service.
